Controller
Class GestureRecord

java.lang.Object
  Controller.GestureRecord

public class GestureRecord
extends java.lang.Object

Class used to capture and process specific joint relations to generate a gesture from. Recording does not support multiple users, more that one user may interfere with recording.

Author:
Levi Lindsley

          Used only for debug purposes

GestureRecord

Default Constructor, initializes control vectors

Method Detail

addFocusJoints

public boolean addFocusJoints(int first,
                              int second)
If there is no recorded data, add a new joint pair to Focus.

Parameters:
first - : First Joint in pair
second - : Second Joint in pair
Returns:
True if the joint pair was added successfully. False if there is recorded data and the pair may not be currently added or if the joint pair is already a focus pair.

record

public void record(SimpleOpenNI.SimpleOpenNI context,
                   int user)
Calculates relationships of all focus pairs retrieved from context and stores them in recorder

Parameters:
context - : SimpleOpenNI instance
user - : user id to retrieve skeletal info from

record

public void record(JointRecorder log,
                   int startTick,
                   int endTick)
Processes the JointRecorder from [startTick , endTick) and adds data to this based on focus joint pairs if available in log. If log does not have all focus joints that this requires then no data will be processed. Note endTick is not included in the processed data.

Parameters:
log - : JointRecorder to parse data from
startTick - : record tick to start at
endTick - : record tick after the final processed tick

record

public void record(JointRecorder log)
Records the entire log to this.recorder

Parameters:
log - : JointRecorder storing the data to process

compressRecording

private void compressRecording()
Removes all duplicate recorded joint comparisons that appear in sequence keeping only the head of the sequence in R.

generateGesture

public GestureController generateGesture(boolean compress)
Creates a GestureController that represents the minimum number of steps required to represent the recording. The recording is NOT reset upon completion and may be used to generate more gestures if desired.

Returns:
GestureController representing the recorded gesture

addNode

boolean addNode(GestureController.JointPair f,
                processing.core.PVector t)
Adds a recorded node? I'm confused the name seemed obvious. This is slightly dangerous as it is assumed that all focus points have equal number of recorded points and this can invalidate that assumption.

Parameters:
f - : focus joint pair that t relationship taken is from
t - : relationship to add to recorder
Returns:
True if there is a focus pair f to add t into the recording of.

resetRecording

public void resetRecording()
Clear all recorded, data focus pairs are preserved.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns data about this recording in a nice string format

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Returns true if there is no recorded data. Will return true if there is focus pairs but no data has been recorded.

Returns:
True if no data is recored.
